   19: %%
   20: 
   21: %%
   22: %% Tests of the server implemented by diameter_sync.erl.
   23: %%
   24: 
   25: -module(diameter_sync_SUITE).
   26: 
   27: %% testcases, no common_test depedency
   28: -export([run/0,
   29:          run/1]).
   30: 
   31: %% common_test wrapping
   32: -export([suite/0,
   33:          all/0,
   34:          parallel/1]).
   35: 
   36: -define(sync, diameter_sync).
   37: 
   38: %% ===========================================================================
   39: 
   40: suite() ->
   41:     [{timetrap, {seconds, 15}}].
   42: 
   43: all() ->
   44:     [parallel].
   45: 
   46: parallel(_Config) ->
   47:     run().
   48: 
   49: %% ===========================================================================
   50: 
   51: %% run/0
   52: 
   53: run() ->
   54:     run([call, cast, timeout, flush]).
   55: 
   56: %% run/1
   57: 
   58: run(List)
   59:   when is_list(List) ->
   60:     ok = diameter:start(),
   61:     try
   62:         diameter_util:run([{[fun run/1, T], 10000} || T <- List])
   63:     after
   64:         ok = diameter:stop()
   65:     end;
   66: 
   67: run(call) ->
   68:     Ref = make_ref(),
   69:     Q = {q, Ref},
   70:     F = fun() -> Ref end,
   71:     Ref = ?sync:call(Q, F, infinity, infinity),
   72:     Ref = ?sync:call(Q, F, 0, infinity),
   73:     Ref = call(Q, F),
   74:     Ref = call(Q, {fun(_) -> Ref end, x}),
   75:     timeout = call(Q, fun() -> exit(unexpected) end),
   76:     {_,_,_} = call(Q, {erlang, now, []}),
   77:     {_,_,_} = call(Q, [fun erlang:now/0]);
   78: 
   79: run(cast) ->
   80:     Ref = make_ref(),
   81:     Q = {q, Ref},
   82:     false = ?sync:carp(Q),
   83:     [] = ?sync:pids(Q),
   84:     %% Queue a request that blocks until we send it Ref and another
   85:     %% that exits with Ref.
   86:     ok = cast(Q, fun() -> receive Ref -> ok end end),
   87:     ok = cast(Q, fun() -> exit(Ref) end),
   88:     [_,Pid] = ?sync:pids(Q),
   89:     %% Ensure some expected truths ...
   90:     2 = ?sync:pending(Q),
   91:     true = 2 =< ?sync:pending(),
   92:     true = lists:member(Q, ?sync:queues()),
   93:     %% ... and that the max number of requests is respected.
   94:     rejected = ?sync:call(Q, {erlang, now, []}, 1, infinity),
   95:     rejected = ?sync:cast(Q, {erlang, now, []}, 1, infinity),
   96:     %% Monitor on the identifiable request and see that exits when we
   97:     %% let the blocking request finish.
   98:     MRef = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
   99:     {value, P} = ?sync:carp(Q),
  100:     P ! Ref,
  101:     Ref = receive {'DOWN', MRef, process, _, Reason} -> Reason end;
  102: 
  103: run(timeout) ->
  104:     Q = make_ref(),
  105:     ok = ?sync:cast(Q, {timer, sleep, [2000]}, infinity, 2000),
  106:     timeout = ?sync:call(Q, fun() -> ok end, infinity, 1000);
  107: 
  108: run(flush) ->
  109:     Q = make_ref(),
  110:     F = {timer, sleep, [2000]},
  111:     ok = cast(Q, F),
  112:     ok = cast(Q, F),
  113:     1 = ?sync:flush(Q).
  114: 
  115: %% ===========================================================================
  116: 
  117: call(Q, Req) ->
  118:     sync(call, Q, Req).
  119: 
  120: cast(Q, Req) ->
  121:     sync(cast, Q, Req).
  122: 
  123: sync(F, Q, Req) ->
  124:     ?sync:F(Q, Req, infinity, infinity).
